metadata.title: CVE-2019-11454 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: Persistent cross-site scripting (XSS) in http/cervlet.c in Tildeslash Monit before 5.25.3 allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to introduce arbitrary JavaScript via manipulation of an unsanitized user field of the Authorization header for HTTP Basic Authentication, which is mishandled during an _viewlog operation. Zack Flack discovered that Monit incorrectly handled certain input. A remote authenticated user could exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.

criterions.comment: monit package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:5.25.3-1').
